item.title: Report E-2024070063
item.description:
Report E-2024070063

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-05T18:14:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-21
  • City: OCALA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 21, 2024, three (3) 50-pound bags of UN3378 were torn by a forklift and released approximately less than one (<1) pound of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Alpha Omega Training and Compliance (AOTC) to remediate the impacted site. AOTC personnel utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the UN3378-impacted trailer. All waste was collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum and staged onsite for transport and disposal. The damaged bag was patched and repalletized for shipment.

item.description:
Report E-2024070008

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-28
  • City: MIAMI
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: LATAM CARGO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: We were alerted regarding a spill on the ramp that due to poor handling punctured a metal barrel containing UN 3082 (Liquid) in element PAG - 61979 r7, Mr. Osnay Requesen (LA - OPS) was told that for safety reasons, isolate the spill area, it must be in a ventilated area since it is emanating a strong odor and contain the spill with vermiculite
